Agilent.m_SMU¶

class models.Agilent.m_SMU.m_SMU(resource)¶

Bases: models.m_Base

defaultSetup()¶

Reset the SMU to factory default settings

getCollector(method, time=0.0)¶

Get all data from a collector after a certain timestamp

Parameters:
  • method (str) – Name of collector-attached method
  • time (float) – Lower bound of time for returned samples
Returns:

list
getMeasurement(**kwargs)¶

Takes a spot measurement

getModelName()¶

Returns the Model class name

Returns:str
getResource()¶

Returns the resource object for interacting with the physical instrument

Returns:object
rampVoltage(startVoltage, stopVoltage, time, delay=0)¶

Automated voltage ramp

Parameters:
  • startVoltage (float) – Starting Voltage
  • stopVoltage (float) – Stop Voltage
  • time (float) – Rise/Fall Time (seconds)
  • delay (float) – Time (seconds) before ramp is started
setCurrentLimit(limit)¶

Set SMU current limit

Parameters:limit (float) – Current limit
setMeasurementSetup(**kwargs)¶

Set SMU Measurement settings.

Warning

This function has not yet been implemented

setPulseSetup(pulseEnable, pulseWidth, delay=0.0)¶

Set SMU Pulse settings

Parameters:
  • pulseEnable (bool) – Enable/Disable Pulsing
  • pulseWidth (float) – Pulse width in seconds - must be greater than 20E-6
  • delay (float) – Delay before first pulse in seconds
setSourceFixed(source, base, peak)¶

Configure the SMU to output a fixed voltage or current

Parameters:
  • source (str) – Voltage or Current Source - [‘VOLTAGE’, ‘CURRENT’]
  • base (float) – Base Voltage/Current
  • peak (float) – Peak Voltage/Current when triggered
setSourceSweep(source, start, stop, points)¶

Configure the SMU to Sweep a range of points.

Parameters:
  • source (str) – Voltage or Current Source - [‘VOLTAGE’, ‘CURRENT’]
  • start (float) – Starting Voltage/Current
  • stop (float) – Final Voltage/Current
  • points (int) – Number of Points
setTriggerSetup(triggerSource, number, interval, delay=0)¶

Set SMU Trigger settings

Parameters:
  • triggerSource (str) – Trigger Source - [‘AINT’, ‘BUS’, ‘TIMER’, ‘INT1’, ‘INT2’, ‘LAN’, ‘EXT1’, ‘EXT2’, ‘EXT3’, ‘EXT4’, ‘EXT5’, ‘EXT6’, ‘EXT7’, ‘EXT8’, ‘EXT9’, ‘EXT10’, ‘EXT11’, ‘EXT12’, ‘EXT13’, ‘EXT14’]
  • number (int) – Number of Triggers per sequence - 1 to 100000 or 2147483647 (INF)
  • interval (float) – Timing interval in seconds - must be greater than 20E-6
  • delay (float) – Delay before first trigger in seconds
startCollector(method, interval, depth)¶

Starts a Collector thread to retrieve data at a regular interval.

Parameters:
  • method (str) – Name of the Model method to invoke
  • interval (float) – Interval in seconds between method invokations
  • depth (int) – Number of samples to keep
Returns:

Boolean, True if successful, False otherwise.
startProgram(channel=1)¶

Start a program sequence / Force trigger.

Parameters:channel (int) – Channel (1 or 2)
